text: Hi everyone, I would like to share this with you guys because this part in the doc is wrong

I just found a way to have 3, no matter the condition is true or false

Add emmet = add lorem ipsum generator, 2 birds 1 codemirror stone
<https://github.com/emmetio/codemirror>

Actually, this might fit better here:

Bot question: is there some sort of way to use some HubSpot API to allow a chat bot to pull in information on a clients Dashboard data? For example, we create a bot that a client could go to and it would ask them if they want to learn about how many new contacts were created this month, how many leads have moved on to MQLs, how many blog views they've generated, and other KPIs like that?

My assumption is that we'd create something that would pull data from HubSpot and then re-assign it as a custom contact property that would then just be displayed as a personalization token (while also assigning those values of those custom fields to the client's records in HubSpot).

I was literally just approached about this my upper management and was curious if someoone else had done this or had ideas about it
There is the new HubSpot Lambda which allows you to execute arbitrary code in bots
<https://github.com/HubSpot/botsworkshop>
Matt, thanks for pointing this out, I'll take a look!
<@U6GNQ7JBU> wait, is this only available for Enterprise level plans?

Looking at <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/conversations/create-bots> it seems you must have `Sales Hub Starter, Service Hub Starter, Marketing Hub Starter, and free users cannot add custom conditions to their bot's conversation flow. `

Matt, just tried making a test bot in a HubSpot account on Marketing Hub Professional and the webhook and run code snippet options are locked. Checked a Marketing Enterprise account though and its available there
